Gillespie.jl: Stochastic Simulation Algorithm in Julia




Gillespie.jl: Stochastic Simulation Algorithm in Julia


Types


Functions










Types


#


Gillespie.SSAStats
 
 
Type
.


A type storing the status at the end of a call to 
ssa
.


#


Gillespie.SSAArgs
 
 
Type
.


A type storing the call to 
ssa
.


#


Gillespie.SSAResult
 
 
Type
.


This type stores the output of 
ssa
, and comprises of:




time
 : a 
Vector
 of 
Float64
, containing the times of simulated events.


data
 : a 
Matrix
 of 
Int64
, containing the simulated states.


stats
 : an instance of 
SSAStats
.


args
 : arguments passed to 
ssa
.






Functions


#


Gillespie.ssa
 
 
Function
.


This function performs Gillespie's stochastic simulation algorithm. It takes the following arguments:




x0
 : a 
Vector
 of 
Int64
, representing the initial states of the system.


F
 : a 
Function
 or a callable type, which itself takes two arguments; x, a 
Vector
 of 
Int64
 representing the states, and parms, a 
Vector
 of 
Float64
 representing the parameters of the system.


nu
 : a 
Matrix
 of 
Int64
, representing the transitions of the system, organised by row.


parms
 : a 
Vector
 of 
Float64
 representing the parameters of the system.


tf
 : the final simulation time (
Float64
)

docs.text: #  Gillespie.SSAStats     Type .  A type storing the status at the end of a call to  ssa .  #  Gillespie.SSAArgs     Type .  A type storing the call to  ssa .  #  Gillespie.SSAResult     Type .  This type stores the output of  ssa , and comprises of:   time  : a  Vector  of  Float64 , containing the times of simulated events.  data  : a  Matrix  of  Int64 , containing the simulated states.  stats  : an instance of  SSAStats .  args  : arguments passed to  ssa .

docs.text: #  Gillespie.ssa     Function .  This function performs Gillespie's stochastic simulation algorithm. It takes the following arguments:   x0  : a  Vector  of  Int64 , representing the initial states of the system.  F  : a  Function  or a callable type, which itself takes two arguments; x, a  Vector  of  Int64  representing the states, and parms, a  Vector  of  Float64  representing the parameters of the system.  nu  : a  Matrix  of  Int64 , representing the transitions of the system, organised by row.  parms  : a  Vector  of  Float64  representing the parameters of the system.  tf  : the final simulation time ( Float64 )
